snippet: New York and other states could save millions of workers from impending poverty by creating public pensions for everyone.
abstract: Op-Ed article by economic Prof Teresa Ghilarducci observes that the New York State Legislature has joined 43 other states by agreeing to a deal limiting pensions for future public employees; suggests New York and other states should instead expand public pension programs for everyone in the state, in effort to address the looming retirement crisis in the country.
lead_paragraph: New York and other states could save millions of workers from impending poverty by creating public pensions for everyone.
